sen.j: 高松塚古墳（たかまつづかこふん）は、奈良県高市郡明日香村（国営飛鳥歴史公園内）に存在する古墳。

sen.e: Around October 1970, a farmer in the village digging a hole to store gingers discovered old hewn stones, which led to the start of the excavation.

sen.j: 横口式石槨の系譜には、鬼の俎板（まないた）・厠（かわや）、皇極天皇陵と推測されている牽牛子塚古墳、野口王墓（天武天皇・持統天皇陵）、キトラ古墳などが入る。
sen.e: Categorized into the Yokoguchishiki Sekkaku are Oni-no-Manaita Stone (The Devil's Chopping Board), kawaya (toilet), the Kengoshizuka Tomb thought to be the burial mound of the Empress Kogyoku, Noguchino Ono-haka-kofun Tumulus (the burial mounds of the Emperor Tenmu and the Empress Jito), and Kitora Tumulus.

sen.j: 壁画は石室の東壁・西壁・北壁（奥壁）・天井の4面に存在し、切石の上に厚さ数ミリの漆喰を塗った上に描かれている。
sen.e: The mural paintings were found on the east, west, and north (deepest) walls and the ceiling, and drawn on few-millimeter plastered cut stones.

sen.j: 壁画の題材は人物像、日月、四方四神および星辰（星座）である。
sen.e: The subject matter of the paintings are a group of people, the sun and moon, shiho shijin (four gods said to rule over the four directions), and seishin (constellation).

sen.e: The painting on the east wall depicts, from the near side, a group of men, a blue dragon (shijin) of the four gods with the sun above, and a group of women.

sen.e: In contrast, the paining on the west wall depicts, from the near side, a group of men, a white tiger of the four gods with the moon above, and a group of women.

sen.e: The items carried by those figures match those carried by the toneri (a servant) and other government officials (especially one of low to medium rank) seen in "Jogan GIshiki (the ritual processes by the Jogan Codes)" who attended a ceremony of Choga (New Year's greetings or well-wishes offered by retainers to the Emperor) on New Year's Day.

sen.e: It is likely that the Suzaku (red Chinese phoenix) was drawn on the south wall which was lost by grave thieves during the Kamakura Period.

sen.j: 天井画は、円形の金箔で星を表し、星と星の間を朱の線でつないで星座を表したものである。
sen.e: On the ceiling painting, round gold leaves represent stars and red lines connecting stars represent constellations.

sen.j: 中央には北極五星と四鋪四星（しほしせい）からなる紫微垣（しびえん）、その周囲には二十八宿を表す。
sen.e: The center represents Shibien consisting of five polestars and Shiho Shisei surrounded by 28 sei shuku (moon stations)..

sen.j: これらは古代中国の思想に基づくもので、中央の紫微垣は天帝の居所を意味している。
sen.e: These are based on ideas of ancient China, in which Shibien in the center means the whereabouts of God of Hosts.

sen.j: 四神はそもそも高句麗様式の古墳に特徴的なモチーフであるが、高松塚古墳およびキトラ古墳では高句麗の画風とは異なった日本独自の画風で四神図が描かれていることが指摘されている。
sen.e: Although shijin was a motif originally characteristic of tombs of the Goguryeo style, it is pointed out that shijin on the painting of Shijin in Takamatsuzuka Tomb and Kitora Tomb are drawn in uniquely Japanese style different from the Goguryeo style.

sen.j: 一方で、天空図に関しては、高句麗から伝来した原図を用いた可能性が指摘されている。

sen.e: The deterioration of the mural painting of Takamatsuzuka Tumulus had not been known to the public until the fact was unveiled in "Kokuho Takamatsuzuka kofun hekiga (Mural-painting in the tumulus Takamatsuzuka)"published by the Agency for Cultural Affair in June 2004 and subsequently widely covered by newspapers.

sen.e: The most murals remained richly-colored, although some parts of the paintings such as the right half of a man in the mural of the east wall had been damaged by sediment and groundwater.

sen.j: このように、関係者の間には現地での保存修復を望む声も依然高かった。
sen.e: These showed that there were yet growing demand among those concerned for the conservation and repairs at the site.

sen.j: 2001年から2002年にかけて起きたカビの大量発生と西壁の損傷事故については第三者による調査委員会（高松塚古墳取合部天井の崩落止め工事及び石室西壁の損傷事故に関する調査委員会、座長石沢良昭・上智大学学長）において再調査された。
sen.e: The third party investigation committee (the committee to investigate the work for preventing the collapse of the ceiling in the Toriaibu of Takamatsuzuka Tumulus and and the damage incidents of the west wall of the chamber, headed by Yoshiaki ISHIZAWA, president of Sophia University) investigated again the growth of a large volume of fungi and the occurrence of damage incidents of the west wall between 2001 and 2002.

The third party investigation committee (the committee to investigate the work for preventing the collapse of the ceiling in the Toriaibu of Takamatsuzuka Tumulus and the damage incidents of the west wall of the chamber, headed by Yoshiaki ISHIZAWA, president of Sophia University) reinvestigated the growth of a large amount of fungi and the occurrence of damage incidents of the west wall between 2001 and 2002.

The third party investigation committee (the committee to investigate the work for preventing the collapse of the ceiling in the Toriaibu of Takamatsuzuka Tumulus and the damage incidents of the west wall of the chamber, headed by Yoshiaki ISHIZAWA, president of Sophia University) reinvestigated the growth of a large amount of fungi and the occurrence of damage incidents of the west wall between 2001 and 2002.

sen.j: 同委員会は2006年6月19日に報告書を国へ提出。
sen.e: The committee submitted a report to the state on June 19, 2006.
The committee submitted a report to the state on June 19, 2006.
The committee submitted a report to the state on June 19, 2006.

sen.j: そこでは、文化庁の縦割りセクショナリズムの弊害、情報公開への意識の低さなどが指摘されている。
sen.e: The report pointed out harmful effects of the vertical sectionalism and low awareness of information disclosure in the Agency for Cultural Affairs.
The report pointed out harmful effects of the vertical sectionalism and low awareness of information disclosure in the Agency for Cultural Affairs.
The report pointed out harmful effects of the vertical sectionalism and low awareness of information disclosure in the Agency for Cultural Affairs.

sen.j: 高松塚古墳の場合、特別史跡である古墳自体は文化庁記念物課、国宝である壁画は美術工芸課（2001年1月より美術学芸課と改称）の管轄である。
sen.e: In case of Takamatsuzuka Tumulus, the Monument and Site Division is in charge of the tumulus itself as a special historic site and Art and Craft Division (whose name changed to Fine Art Division in January 2001) is in charge of the mural paintings as a national treasure.

In case of Takamatsuzuka Tumulus, the Monument and Site Division is in charge of the tumulus itself as a special historic site and the Art and Craft Division (whose name changed to Fine Art Division in January 2001) is in charge of the mural paintings as a national treasure.

In case of Takamatsuzuka Tumulus, the Monument and Site Division is in charge of the tumulus itself as a special historic site and the Art and Craft Division (whose name changed to Fine Art Division in January 2001) is in charge of the mural paintings as a national treasure.

sen.j: 両者の連携が十分ではなかったとされている。
sen.e: The coordination of the two divisions was reported to be inadequate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The coordination of the two divisions was reported to be inadequate.
The coordination of the two divisions was reported to be inadequate.

sen.j: 2001年2月の天井崩落防止工事に伴うカビの大量発生については、作業員が滅菌した防護服を着用していなかったことが原因とされている。
sen.e: The growth of a large volume of fungi associated with the works to prevent the collapse of the ceiling in February 2001 was reported to be caused by unsterilized preventive clothing the workers worn.
The growth of a large amount of fungi associated with the works to prevent the collapse of the ceiling in February 2001 was reported to be caused by unsterilized preventive clothing of the workers.
The growth of a large amount of fungi associated with the works to prevent the collapse of the ceiling in February 2001 was reported to be caused by unsterilized preventive clothing of the workers.

sen.j: この工事は記念物課が発注したが、現場の管理は美術学芸課にまかせきりで、記念物課の職員は工事に一切立ち会わなかった。
sen.e: The Monument and Site Division ordered the works and left the management at the site only to the Art and Craft Division with no attendance of the staff of the Monument and Site Division.
The Monument and Site Division ordered the works and left the management at the site only to the Art and Craft Division with no attendance of the staff of the Monument and Site Division.
The Monument and Site Division ordered the works and left the management at the site only to the Art and Craft Division with no attendance of the staff of the Monument and Site Division.

sen.j: 東京文化財研究所には工事を実施すること自体が知らされていなかった。
sen.e: National Research Institute for Cultural Properties, Tokyo was not informed of the work at all.
National Research Institute for Cultural Properties, Tokyo was not informed of the work at all.
National Research Institute for Cultural Properties, Tokyo was not informed of the work at all.

sen.j: また、防護服の着用などを定めた「保存修理マニュアル」の存在も現場に周知されていなかった。
sen.e: The workers did not know the presence of "Manual of Conservation and Repairs," which required them to wear the protective clothing.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The workers did not know the presence of a "Manual of Conservation and Repairs," which specified that they had to wear protective clothing.
The workers did not know the presence of a "Manual of Conservation and Repairs," which specified that they had to wear protective clothing.

sen.j: 結果的にカビの大量発生を招いた。
sen.e: This resulted in the growth of a large volume of fungi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: This resulted in the growth of a large amount of fungi.
This resulted in the growth of a large amount of fungi.

sen.j: しかも、カビ発生の事実が公表されたのはそれから2年も後のことであった。
sen.e: Moreover, the fact that fungi grew was made public two years later.
Moreover, the fact that fungi grew was made public two years later.
Moreover, the fact that fungi grew was made public two years later.

sen.j: 2002年1月には前述のとおり西壁の2箇所に損傷が生じているが、文化庁はこの事実を公表せず、傷が目立たないように補彩していた。
sen.e: Although two portions of the west wall were damaged in January 2002 as mentioned above, the Agency for Cultural Affairs did not disclose this fact and repaired the colors so the damage became inconspicuous.

Although two portions of the west wall were damaged in January 2002 as mentioned above, the Agency for Cultural Affairs did not disclose this fact and repaired the colors so the damage became inconspicuous.

Although two portions of the west wall were damaged in January 2002 as mentioned above, the Agency for Cultural Affairs did not disclose this fact and repaired the colors so the damage became inconspicuous.

sen.j: 補彩は上記の西壁の2箇所以外に東壁、北壁、天井にも行われていた。
sen.e: In addition to these two portions of the west wall, the paintings of the east and north walls and the ceiling were also repaired by adding colors.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In addition to these two portions of the west wall, the paintings of the east and north walls and the ceiling were also repaired by adding colors.
In addition to these two portions of the west wall, the paintings of the east and north walls and the ceiling were also repaired by adding colors.

sen.j: これについても公表されなかった。
sen.e: This fact was not disclosed, either.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: This fact was not disclosed, either.

sen.j: また、西壁損傷事故の2年前の2000年3月21日に撮影された（損傷前の）壁画写真を「最新の写真」と偽って新聞社に提供していたことも明らかになった。
sen.e: It was also revealed that the agency falsely claimed the pictures of the (undamaged) mural taken on March 21 2000--two years before the damage incident--as "the latest pictures of the mural paintings" and provide a new paper with them.

It was also revealed that the agency falsely claimed the pictures of the (undamaged) mural taken on March 21 2000--two years before the damage incident--as "the latest pictures of the mural paintings" and provide a new paper with them.

It was also revealed that the agency had provided newspaper companies with what they claimed were recent pictures of the (undamaged) mural, but these had actually been taken on March 21, 2000--two years before the damage to the west wall occurred.
sen.cmt: 西壁損傷事故の西壁の訳漏れに対応しました。

sen.j: この事態を受けて、文化庁により「国宝高松塚古墳壁画恒久保存対策」を目的とした古墳の発掘調査が始まった。
sen.e: In corresponding to these situations, the Agency for Cultural Affairs started excavation and research of the tumulus with an aim to "conserve eternally mural paintings in the Takamatsuzuka Tumulus."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In response to these situations, the Agency for Cultural Affairs started excavation and research of the tumulus to "conserve mural paintings in the Takamatsuzuka Tumulus eternally."
In response to these situations, the Agency for Cultural Affairs started excavation and research of the tumulus to "conserve mural paintings in the Takamatsuzuka Tumulus eternally."

sen.j: 埋もれていた周溝などが発見されて古墳の本来の形状が明らかにされつつある。
sen.e: The surrounding burial mound and other buried constructions were discovered, which has helped reveal how was originally structured.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The surrounding burial mound and other buried constructions were discovered, which the tumulus has helped reveal how was originally structured.

sen.j: また、墳丘からは過去の地震によると思われる亀裂が多数発見されている。
sen.e: Many cracks possibly caused by past earthquakes were also found on the tumulus.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Many cracks possibly caused by past earthquakes were also found on the tumulus.

sen.j: 虫や雨水の進入経路になったと考えられている。
sen.e: These are considered as the routes that insects and rainwater may have passed through.

sen.j: 墳丘の発掘調査と石室の解体修理は2006年10月2日に開始された。
sen.e: The excavation and research of the tumulus and discomposing and repairs of the stone chamber started on October 2, 2006.
The excavation and research of the tumulus and discomposing and repairs of the stone chamber started on October 2, 2006.

sen.j: 2007年1月には古墳全体を覆う断熱覆屋が完成した。
sen.e: In January 2007, the heat-insulating covering roof that covers the entire tumulus was completed.

sen.j: 内部の温湿度は10℃、90％に保たれた。

sen.j: 同年3月12日には国営飛鳥歴史公園内に修理施設が完成した。
sen.e: On March 12 in the same year, a renovation facility was completed in Askuka Historical National Government Park.

sen.j: 石室はいったん解体・搬出した後、この修理施設へ移され、修復が行われることになった。
sen.e: It was decided that the stone chamber was once discomposed and carried out to this renovation facility for repairs.
It was decided that the stone chamber was once discomposed and carried out to this renovation facility for repairs.

sen.j: 4月5日には4枚の天井石のうちの1枚がクレーンで吊り上げられ、専用車両で修理施設へと移された。
sen.e: On April 5, one of the four pieces of the ceiling stone were lifted with a crane to be moved with a dedicated vehicle to the renovation facility.

sen.j: 以後、4枚の天井石と8枚の壁石は1枚ずつ移動され、5月10日・5月11日には「西壁石3」と呼ばれる、「飛鳥美人」が描かれた石が移動された。
sen.e: All of the four pieces ceiling stones and 8 pieces of the wall stones were relocated piece by piece and the wall called "west wall stone 3"--on which Asuka Bijin (Asuka beauties) was drawn--was moved on May 10 and 11.
sen.cmt: 「以後」をつけると４枚の数字があわなくなるため、訳し出ししていません。

sen.j: 最後の12枚目の壁石（西壁石1）が移動されたのは6月26日のことである。

sen.j: 移動された壁画は、10年間かけて保存修理が行われ、修理完成後はもとの古墳へ戻される予定になっている。
sen.e: The relocated mural paintings are scheduled to be conserved and repaired in 10 years and, upon completion, carried back to where they were.

sen.j: 修理中の2008年11月25日に顔料分析中、東壁女子群像の顔料部分を機材で損傷する事故を起こしている。
